result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren B Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with the co-defendant Darren Washington,  Letreya Powell, Marquise Brown and Washington County Fleet Farm Stores.
Defendant shall not possess a firearm.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Def in person & by Atty Deborah Ann Strigenz.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on September 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Deborah Ann Strigenz.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Agreement not reached on sentencing; however, defendant does not object to probation.   No contest plea entered.  Court finds def guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Hearing on August 24, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Deborah Ann Strigenz.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State, w/ intern Michelle Alexander;    If matter not resolved will set for trial.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Authorization to Appear
Letter received from Atty Deborah Strigenz
Hearing on July 20, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Atty Deborah Ann Strigenz appearing for Def.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Counsel's first appearance.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Per request of Atty. Deborah Strigenz, 6-15-16 hearing at 9:45 a.m. rescheduled to 8:15 a.m. on same date.  DA notified via email by Judge's clerk.
Hearing on June 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def appeared in person without counsel.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Court admonishes Defendant to see SPD today and contact information provided.  Court may consider setting matter for trial at next court date if Defendant appears with or without counsel.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.
No contact with any Fleet Farm in Washington County
Hearing on May 18, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.  Court questions State re complaint.  Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Court sets $1000 signature bond.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 09:45 am.
